SEARCH
Module janitor.PartsMenu
Package janitor.PartsMenu

Class ProdModController

java.lang.Object
janitor.PartsMenu.ProdModController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ProdModController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controls the FXML elements for the "Modify Product" window and includes methods and data types to act on that window. FUTURE ENHANCEMENT: Automatic display of stats related to the items associated parts list would be helpful. That way you could have easier access to information when evaluating how worthwhile the product is. It could help make purchasing decisions and that way you could better align your goals with your finances

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Main initialize function that loads the data to be modified, including the table values, the Object data, and its previous state. RUNTIME ERROR: I had a very difficult time trying to properly instantiate the data for the Products Table when using baseline, empty Data table values. The issue was that when you have a preset amount of items that don't have explicit parts associated with them, you try and initialize them, and you get an error stating that it tried to load null data tables. To fix that, I had to add another data attribute to the Parts object and then give it something so that the table wouldn't fail to load
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The URL, if any, to pull data from
      resourceBundle - Any included resources

      public javafx.scene.control.TableView<Part> onProdAddSave(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws Exception
      Collects the entered product information, including the Products table with its associated "Added" parts, and passes it back to the main Products table.
      Parameters:
